posts.body:
I feel like I'm back in the  late 90s. Just with better net. Is this actually fun?

Edit: There's an edit button?

posts.subject: Edgar Friendly
posts.body: This is my face when

>>61f46662-e9d1-4854-9ca2-06f8af8e24a0
>>befb6999-3324-4fba-998d-03aa16e33106
http://archivecaslytosk.onion/7cc9v

As long as they have the eternal foot in the door of censorship named cp firmly entrenched in society there will always be a fight, and you will always be on the defensive. It doesn't mean you shouldn't fight, just that as long as the idea of harmful information isn't abolished you cannot stop being vigilant.
It doesn't matter that they're here. It matters that they can't touch the site as easily.

posts.subject: Temporary ERP Bunker Rules
posts.body:
Welcome to the - for now - temporary home of erotic role playing. Until fate decides otherwise, this space shall exist to serve all of your depraved, kinky, role playing needs. Feel free to recreate lost threads, reconnect with anons you miss, or just hang out and typefuck with random strangers until your fingers cramp up.

Here are the rules.
⬤ Don't be a thread-hijacking drama fag
⬤ Remember that the mute button exists
⬤ Keep Zeronet running to help the site survive

Enjoy.

>>be0760c9-5aba-461b-ba19-b52bb2e41fc8
It only appears to be that right now. You forget that as time moves on more people will be thrown off the clearnet, people with less and less unorthodox opinions and interests. This is how 8chan grew in the first place, remember?

>>1da607e2-fcbc-4da9-b1a7-472278ec06a5
>no true anon
You haven't been around for long have you? If you can get away with it, people will post it. Why do you think people posted  child gore on 8ch? Whatever, the solution is simple. Mute and be done with it.
What does this do anyway?

>>67ce0812-df1a-4150-91a8-757259350527
Be aware, though, that anyone can post cp at anytime anywhere on the site, so you're never truly safe. It really decreases the chances, though, so thanks for risking it.

>>711738d0-f1fd-4b93-a0f1-01e58e41ca88
Yeah. If anything has the power to jump start a growth in decentralized hosting its events like these, targeting a community made up of dozens of interest groups.  Not just one or two as its usually the case. 
Part of me hopes that 8chan will return, but another hopes that it wont, and the anons here have reached a critical mass to keep the site alive.

Also, this nigger right here. 

What are you doing, man.

>>eaebfe79-c05c-40db-96d4-2a19f3ad6bfc
>installing
It's literally just extracting a zip folder and opening an executable. 
They didn't come to 8chan because it was one mouse click away,  they came to it because some of their staff most likely posted there and talked about it.

>>b4267413-f38d-4ddf-8e33-73602ba2eeb6
Because police didn't care about people having illegal bits as much as people abusing kids. 
Up until the 90s it was legal in Japan to distribute cp, and possession was outlawed in 2014, both bans having been the result of decade long pressure by the West.

There's this cable about cp and why it's basically the holy grail of power for authority, and why they pushed so hard to make it illegal everywhere. The possession and distribution, that is, not the creation ofc. I forgot the name of it, though. It's been years.

>>8a9eae2b-09ae-4450-ba8f-1a88e3f9364d
Look at the bottom of the board. It says "millchan engine". It works the same way.

>>3f107d84-bf07-4517-b300-49eb09709e8c
I literally knew nothing about zero until today, but since I'm not tech illiterate and it's literally as easy as starting a program and entering a URL, it's not as far fetched as you think for someone who is a pseudo normie, like certain game devs, to figure it out. Come on, they can code. They can get on 08chan.

As for the deterrent that is the almighty cheese pizza, that also existed on 8chan. Not as openly and in your face as a cp board, but things like /b/ and legal teen shit does possess enough power to make NPCs shudder at the thought, not to mention loli. 
Sure, the real deal might be a step too far for some game devs to take. Time will tell. It's too early to say anything with certainty. If 8ch remains dead and 08chan grows, it might change in ways that we haven't thought about yet.
 
An opt in adult content board filter would be gay as hell out of principle, and I wouldn't be in favor, but it'd certainly help situations like new users use the site. Cause despite what anon says, if you prevent new people from becoming part of your group out of fear they might be turncoats, your community will die in obscurity. There has to be an influx of newfags, but it's on the rest of us to separate the wheat from the chaff.

>>5a7d9f76-55c8-49d8-9cef-90ba4e09c756
Would be awesome if you could only share certain boards without having to mute the ones you dont want to.

>>12e551c2-193a-4660-bd84-1e70b6ec7c28
Seeding threads or entire boards would make the most sense, with the additional option to seed all for those that live on the moon without cp laws.

>>951d90a9-83f8-4a67-8db1-802e7ed085cb
It's clear that they want to disassociate themselves from "problematic" sites, and 8chan's name is currently all over the news and associated with domestic terrorism. Forget about it.

>>a2af1b51-f7ba-4718-92a0-92a24f5f4b42
The existence of the legal term obscenity also does, but it's still part of the legal system.
Zoomer detected. Welcome to the internet of the 90s and early 2000s. Protect yourself, but also don't be a fucking nigger crying about bad pixels.
It's just sad that zeronet will drive away almost all of the drawfags and artists that frequented the old place. Eh, baraag wont survive for long on the clearnet, I reckon, so here's hoping.
Does 08chan have a mascot yet?

I keep pinning certain boards but after a while they unpin themselves for no reason. Any idea why?

Tor and Zeronet here btw.

>>f5a4a64c-9947-4ff8-9594-f8f11321cbca
Doesn't load for me, so someone else has to judge.

>>1917182e-b1e7-4b13-b568-ae2d5d1fd078
Ah, now it works. I mean,  Iike it. Cable Tan. Though IMO it's missing a visual cue for the number 8 or infinity. I do like the design as is. I dunno, maybe some of the cable hair in her shadow(if present) could be forming a sideways eight. Whatever, gj!

>>c4e1b579-e058-4ca9-960a-ca7c6238cf31
Clothes? She looks nice as it is, and the long cable hair can be used to make sfw versions of her if needed. 

Maybe an ankle bracelet. You might be able to draw it in a way that reminds of the zeronet symbol. That's all I can think of atm.

>>21ee76be-acb3-4a74-bd87-835a43c24030
After a while, though, the pins get reset and I have to do it all over again. Kind of annoying.

>>036f68f6-ea31-464f-950c-71d2a799c630
She's getting closer and closer to being a Digimon villain.

>>197146b0-e13f-4f7d-b195-146630a34c18
I haven't changed certificates yet, and even if I accidentally had it set up so that it would at the end of a session, boards getting unpinned within the same session for me. I've reloaded the index after two hours and it did unpin everything. I've set my cache limit high enough too. No idea why it keeps doing that.
